analysis:
Entries in art and design subjects have decreased a little across the UK over the last five years. The -3.2% change compared to a change of -6.7% in all A-Level entries over the last five years. Over the same period, the 18-year-old population has changed by approximately -7.9%.

Across the UK, a greater proportion of students achieved the top grades in art and design subjects in 2020 compared to all A-Level subjects. A total of 31.3% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in art and design subjects compared to 27.9% for all subjects.

Entries in biology have increased a little across the UK over the last five years. The +3.8% change compared to a change of -6.7% in all A-Level entries over the last five years. Over the same period, the 18-year-old population has changed by approximately -7.9%.

Across the UK, a broadly similar proportion of students achieved the top grades in biology in 2020 as did so across all A-Level subjects. A total of 25.5% of pupils achieved A*-A grades in biology compared to 27.9% for all subjects.
